maml:description.maml:para: Visualizes data to a new or existing timeline.
Visualizes data to a new or existing timeline.

The data item property name or script block that defines the event details for the data sample. The value of the script block or property must evaluate to a string or the details will not be displayed in the timeline.

The data item property name or script block that defines the time duration for the data sample. If the timeline axis is datetime-based, this property must evalute to a TimeSpan value or an error will result. If the timeline axis is numeric, this property must evaluate to a number or an error will result.

command:parameter.maml:name: Units

maml:description.maml:para: The units to display on the timeline. Defaults to Auto. This parameter has no effect if the timeline axis is numeric.

command:parameter.command:parameterValue: Auto | Days | Hours | Milliseconds | Minutes | Months | Seconds | Weeks | Years

maml:description.maml:para: The data item property name, script block, or wildcard pattern that defines the event title to plot on the timeline. The value of the script block or property must evaluate to a string or the title will not be displayed in the timeline.

The data item property name or script block that defines the data to map to the timeline axis. The value of the property or script block must be a datetime or number or an error will result. If this value is a datetime, the timeline axis will be time-based; if it is a number, the axis will be numeric.
The data item property name or script block that defines the series key for each data item.
The data item property name or script block that defines the series collection for each data item.
The name of the visualization. Visualization names are unique within visualization types.
The data source to visualize. This can be one of the following:

maml:listItem.maml:para: A data source object.
The PowerShell path to a data source item on the datasources: drive.
A script block that emits data items asynchronously.
A collection of objects that represent the data items.

maml:description.maml:para: Series definitions to apply to the current visualization. This parameter must be specified as a hashtable. The hashtable keys must be:

maml:listItem.maml:para: A string value representing the data item property name to which the series applies.
A regular expression object used to match property names. The series definition is applied to all matching properties.

maml:description.maml:para: The hashtable values must be series definitions in the form of <scale name>, <color name>, <ranges>
where:

maml:listItem.maml:para: <scale name> is the name of the scale associated with the series (required)
<color name> is a standard color name, an #RRGGBB color string, or the character ? to derive a random color. This field is optional and is omitted, a random color choice will be generated
<ranges> is a list of numbers and strings describing key value ranges in the data (optional). Key value ranges can be described as:
empty (e.g., 0,60)
using a specific color name (e.g., 0,'Green',60)
using a color derived from the series color and range index (e.g., 0,?,60)
using an #RRGGBB color identifier (e.g., 0,"#00FFFF",60)

maml:description.maml:para: The data item property name or script block that defines the event details for the data sample. The value of the script block or property must evaluate to a string or the details will not be displayed in the timeline.

The data item property name or script block that defines the time duration for the data sample. If the timeline axis is datetime-based, this property must evalute to a TimeSpan value or an error will result. If the timeline axis is numeric, this property must evaluate to a number or an error will result.

command:parameter.maml:name: Units

maml:description.maml:para: The units to display on the timeline. Defaults to Auto. This parameter has no effect if the timeline axis is numeric.

command:parameter.command:parameterValue: Auto | Days | Hours | Milliseconds | Minutes | Months | Seconds | Weeks | Years

maml:description.maml:para: The data item property name or script block that defines the data to map to the timeline axis. The value of the property or script block must be a datetime or number or an error will result. If this value is a datetime, the timeline axis will be time-based; if it is a number, the axis will be numeric.

The data item property name, script block, or wildcard pattern that defines the event title to plot on the timeline. The value of the script block or property must evaluate to a string or the title will not be displayed in the timeline.
The data item property name or script block that defines the series key for each data item.
The data item property name or script block that defines the series collection for each data item.
The name of the visualization. Visualization names are unique within visualization types.
The data source to visualize. This can be one of the following:

maml:listItem.maml:para: A data source object.
The PowerShell path to a data source item on the datasources: drive.
A script block that emits data items asynchronously.
A collection of objects that represent the data items.

maml:description.maml:para: Series definitions to apply to the current visualization. This parameter must be specified as a hashtable. The hashtable keys must be:

maml:listItem.maml:para: A string value representing the data item property name to which the series applies.
A regular expression object used to match property names. The series definition is applied to all matching properties.

maml:description.maml:para: The hashtable values must be series definitions in the form of <scale name>, <color name>, <ranges>
where:

maml:listItem.maml:para: <scale name> is the name of the scale associated with the series (required)
<color name> is a standard color name, an #RRGGBB color string, or the character ? to derive a random color. This field is optional and is omitted, a random color choice will be generated
<ranges> is a list of numbers and strings describing key value ranges in the data (optional). Key value ranges can be described as:
empty (e.g., 0,60)
using a specific color name (e.g., 0,'Green',60)
using a color derived from the series color and range index (e.g., 0,?,60)
using an #RRGGBB color identifier (e.g., 0,"#00FFFF",60)

maml:description.maml:para: A reference to a data source object or a string containing the PowerShell path to a data source item on the datasources: drive. For information on creating data sources explicitly, see: about_SeeShell_DataSources.

A reference to a data source object or a string containing the PowerShell path to a data source item on the datasources: drive. For information on creating data sources explicitly, see: about_SeeShell_DataSources.

A script block that emits data samples. Note that the script block will be run asynchronously. In addition, it will be evaluated in a runspace outside of the main PowerShell session, and will not be able to reference the local runspace state.

A script block that emits data samples. Note that the script block will be run asynchronously. In addition, it will be evaluated in a runspace outside of the main PowerShell session, and will not be able to reference the local runspace state.
A list of objects to visualize. The objects are considered a complete data set, with each object a single data sample.
A list of objects to visualize. The objects are considered a complete data set, with each object a single data sample.
This cmdlet does not produce pipeline output.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the InputObject parameter is not an existing data source, an implicit data source will be created. Implicit data sources are limited to the default sample size of 20. If you require a larger sample size, create a data source explicitly.
Script blocks can be piped to visualization cmdlets, but cannot be specified as parameters. This is due to the fact that script blocks are used as filters on pipeline input in PowerShell.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------
command:example.dev:code: get-eventlog -log application -newest 10 | out-timeline -name events -plot Message -by TimeGenerated

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a timeline that plots the last 10 messages from the application event log.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------
command:example.dev:code: get-eventlog -log application -newest 10 | out-timeline -name events -plot Category -by TimeGenerated -detailsFrom Message

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a timeline that plots the last 10 events from the application event log. The event category is plotted against the event generation time; clicking on an individual event in the timeline will display the event log message.
